page.title: 16The York Outer Ring Road
page.content: The York outer Relief road is being built to join the existing A64 south-west of the city It is to be a single carriage road but with land purchased on either side to convert it later to a dual carriage-way The by-pass is to cross the river between Clifton and Skelton and a roundabout is being built at Rawcliffe to link with the busy Shipton road into Clifton and York. The by-pass continues across Clifton airfield and Clifton Moor.Work is at present on time and due for completion at the end of 1986.Local farmers will have problems when their land is divided by the new road. Mr Leaf a farmer at Clifton Gate hopes to solve this problem by crossing with animals and machinery very early in the morning.He welcomes the new road.
